p1: This page contains all the necessary information to upload results to O-Replay. Please read it carefully. If you have any issues or questions, feel free to contact us at <2>support@oreplay.es</2>. Note that O-Replay is completely free to use.

Registering.title: Registering with O-Replay
Registering.p1: Currently, the only way to register is by sending an email to <2>support@oreplay.es</2> with the following information (we speak both English and Spanish):
Registering.p2: Please note that O-Replay is in beta testing and active development. Many planned features are not yet available, and the system is not ready for use in major events.

DownloadClient.title: Downloading and Installing the client
DownloadClient.p1: Results are uploaded using a small program that must be installed on your computer. We provide an installer that works on Windows 11. Simply follow the installer instructions.
DownloadClient.p2: For older Windows versions, such as Windows 10, you can still try the installer. You might encounter a warning that the program contains malware, but don’t worry, this is due to the absence of a digital signature not because we are a real malware.
DownloadClient.p3: If you are using other operating systems, such as Linux or macOS, or your Windows 10 installation fails you can still use the client via <1>manual installation</1>.

ManageClient.title: Managing the client
ManageClient.p1: Follow the next steps to upload files:

list1.item1: Open the O-Replay Desktop Client and click <1>"Check connection"</1>.
list1.item2: Paste the security key (you will get it after creating the event on the web, we will se that later), then click <2>"Enter"</2> and select the stage you want to upload data to. You will get the event Id and security token when you create the event.
list1.item3: Choose the directory where you will export files to, then press <2>"Start"</2>. The client will now monitor this folder for any `XML` or `csv` files. When you export start times or results from your timekeeping software, the client will read the file and upload it to O-Replay. Files will be automatically deleted after successful uploads.

ManageClient.p2: The option "Split by class" makes a different connection to the server for each class. This option was created for development purposes, it can be either checked or unchecked.

CreateEvent.title: Creating an Event
CreateEvent.p1: Races in O-Replay are organized into events and stages. For example, if you are running a weekend championship with middle and long-distance races, you would create one event "Championship" with two stages: "Middle Distance" and "Long Distance." Each stage can represent a different orienteering discipline.
CreateEvent.p2: When you log in, you will see all your events. You can also create new events. Begin by filling in the event details, then add as many stages as needed. If your event has only one race called "My First Race," create an event named "My First Race" with one stage called "Race". Only the event's name will be displayed. Make sure to create at least one stage; otherwise, you will not be able to upload any data.
CreateEvent.p3: After creating the event and stages, generate a security token. This token acts as a secret password for uploading results and can be shared with your team of timekeepers without exposing your O-Replay credentials. Please note that tokens expires one month after creation, but they can be renewed at any time. When they are renewed, the old token becomes invalid and a new one is generated. Use this option if your token gets compromised.

img1.alt: Menu to create security tokens for an event

UploadStartTimes.title: Uploading Start Times
UploadStartTimes.p1: Start times are uploaded for two purposes:

list1.item1: To display them for runners' information.

UploadStartTimes.p2: We only support IOF XML v3 files. Get O-Replay Desktop Client ready for files and export the start times from your timekeeping software:

OE2010.title: OE2010
OE2010.p1: You need to export the start times XML file. Go to "Start list" → "Reports" → "Classes":

img1.alt: Menu that has to be chosen

OE2010.p3: Save using IOF XML v3 in the folder O-Replay Client is listening.

OE12.title: OE12
OE12.p1: You need to export the start times XML file. Go to Start list → start list reports → by classes:

img1.alt: Menu that has to be chosen

OE12.p3: Save using IOF XML in the folder O-Replay Client is listening.

MeOS.title: MeOS
MeOS.p1: You need to export the start times XML file. Go to Competition → Export data → Start List

img1.alt: Menu to export start list in MeOS

MeOS.p2: Select all the classes, choose "IOF Start List" and export the file to the folder the client is listening to.

img2.alt: Menu to choose classes to export and set IOF XML format

UploadStartTimes.p3: If your event has multiple stages, you will have to upload start times for each of the stages.

InfoBox1.title: Races without start times:
InfoBox1.p1: If you are using a start control and runners don’t have preassigned start times, it is recommended to upload entries in IOF XML format. This allows to display all the entries, and competitors can see how many runners are yet to finish.

WarnBox1.title: Uploading start times after results
WarnBox1.p1: No start times can be uploaded after uploading results. If you want to upload start times after uploading results you need to Reset the event first.

UploadingResults.title: Uploading Results
UploadingResults.p1: We support IOF XML v3 splits files for uploading results. Use an empty folder to save these files (you can reuse the folder created for start times).
UploadingResults.p2: Get the client ready and listening for new files, then export result from your timekeeping software:

OE2010.title: OE2010
OE2010.p1: You need to export the splits XML file. Go to "Results" → "Splits times" → "Classes":

img1.alt: Menu that has to be chosen

OE2010.p2: Due to a bug in OE2010, you must export results without decimal places. In the settings menu at the left side, go to "Report Formats" and choose "HH:MM:SS" as the time format.
OE2010.p3: You need to export all runners, including DNS. In the settings menu at the left side, go to "More options" → "How many competitors?" and choose "All". Uncheck "ExcLude dns".
OE2010.p4: Export regularly the splits using Automatic report. In the left side settings menu, go to "Automatic report". Then, set the automatic actions only to "export" and your desired refresh interval. Finally, hit start.
OE2010.p5: Save using IOF XML v3 in the folder O-Replay Client is listening.

OE12.title: OE12
OE12.p1: You need to export the splits XML file. Go to Results → Splits times → by classes:

img1.alt: Menu that has to be chosen

OE12.p2: You need to export all the runners. Uncheck the option "Exclude dns".
OE12.p3: Set the automatic report at your desired refresh interval.
OE12.p4: Save using IOF XML in the folder O-Replay Client is listening.

MeOS.title: MeOS
MeOS.p1: You need to export the splits XML file. Go to Services → Available Services → Results Online

img1.alt: Menu to activate a service to export results in MeOS

MeOS.p2: This service has a lot of different configuration options. You have to set:

list1.TimeInterval: <0>Time interval</0>: How frequent are the results updated. 30 seconds or 1 minute are common values.
list1.SaveToDisk: <0>Save to disk</0>: Is the only option that has to be ticked. Choose the folder O-Replay Client is listening to.

img2.alt: Standart options of Results Online service to work with O-Replay in MeOS

UploadingResults.p3: Many people ask whether they can upload results to both Liveresultats and O-Replay simultaneously. Liveresultats has served us well for many years, and we truly appreciate its contributions. However, we firmly believe that O-Replay is the future, offering all the same features and many more in a more user-friendly way.
UploadingResults.p4: That said, if you choose to use both platforms, you must export the files to separate folders. Otherwise, both clients will compete for access—reading, processing, and deleting the same files—which will prevent either from functioning correctly.

WarnBox1.title: Regular results export (i.e. no splits)
WarnBox1.p1: While the client supports uploading results files without splits, this is strongly discouraged. Without splits, virtual tickets and split details cannot be displayed.

WarnBox2.title: Upload failing with large number of runners
WarnBox2.p1: If you are uploading a large number of results (e.g., about 1,000 runners) that have not been uploaded previously, the process may take up to a minute. If it takes longer than one minute, an error will occur. In this case, try uploading the same results again two or three more times. Some classes may already have been saved to the server, so the process will eventually be completed.

WhatIfAnythingWrong.title: What to Do If Something Goes Wrong
WhatIfAnythingWrong.p1: If you encounter any issues while uploading start times or results (e.g., uploading data to the wrong stage), you can reset the stage. This will delete all the data uploaded to that stage, allowing you to start over. When you reset a stage, it will be completely empty—just as if it had been newly created—so you will need to re-upload the start times and results.
WhatIfAnythingWrong.p2: To reset a stage, go to the event page and click the settings wheel of that stage. Then click the "Reset" option.
WhatIfAnythingWrong.p3: This option is also helpful if there are issues with runner information not displaying correctly. For example, if a competitor’s class is changed, the system may treat it as a different person, causing the runner to appear in both the old and new classes. Resetting and re-uploading ensures that all information is accurately updated.
